headline: At least 20 dead, 79 injured in Lebanon fuel tanker explosion
summarized_story:

The Red Cross said that 20 persons were killed and 79 were injured in the Akkar area incident, with 24 ambulances and 75 EMTs responding at the scene, and a search for missing people was also underway.

headline: Death toll from Haiti earthquake now 724 as tropical storm looms
summarized_story:

Churches, hotels, hospitals, and schools were severely damaged or destroyed, and the tremendous shudders that shook Haiti ripped open the walls of a prison.
The approach of tropical storm Grace, which is expected to hit Haiti with heavy rain on Monday, is expected to hamper the rescue attempts.

headline: Ivory Coast Records First Case of Ebola in 25 years
summarized_story:
Ivory Coast has recorded its first case of the Ebola hemorrhagic virus in 25 years, according to the country’s health minister.
In a separate statement, the World Health Organization (WHO) said the case was Ivory Coast’s first Ebola infection since 1994.
Guinea – site of the 2014-2016 Ebola outbreak, the deadliest on record – experienced a four-month Ebola outbreak earlier this year that was declared over on June 19.
The WHO said there was no indication the current case in Ivory Coast is linked to the outbreak in Guinea earlier this year.
The WHO said it was helping to coordinate a cross-border response, which included transferring 5,000 doses of the Ebola vaccine from Guinea to Ivory Coast.

headline: Over 300 Dead After Haiti Struck by Deadly 7.2-Magnitude Earthquake
summarized_story:
A powerful earthquake has struck the Caribbean nation of Haiti, killing at least 304 people and injuring more than 1,800.
Haiti is still recovering from a devastating 2010 earthquake.
Archdeacon Abiade Lozama, head of an Episcopal church in Les Cayes, told the New York Times: “The streets are filled with screaming.
We lived [through] the 2010 earthquake and all I could do was run.
The 2010 earthquake in Haiti killed more than 200,000 people and caused extensive damage to infrastructure and the economy.
